author: Joseph C. Sternberg
title: The European Union’s Democracy Deficit
text:
Brussels this week considered a new answer to a question that has long vexed the European Union: Who exactly runs this thing? In classic EU fashion, it boils down to a choice between “anyone and everyone” and “someone and no one.”

European leaders seem to have concluded that 2018 will be the year they fix the EU—or else. French President Emmanuel Macron and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker primed the pump last year with a series of major speeches on the bloc’s future, focusing on the need for greater economic...
